body: @Chida15 0.98 is the object confidence, not the IoU.

> @Chida15 0.98 is the object confidence, not the IoU.

thanks a lot for your prompt reply. Another problem I met is that the precision of my training results is pretty low, which is about 0.2 after 60 epochs while the recall is high, about 0.8-0.9.

I have tried improving the hyper parameter iou_t(training), but it doesn't work.
NOTE THAT: iou_t = 0.3, obj_pw=50

And although the recall is high during training period, when it turns to test, it also becomes low, about 0.4(I used default threshes to test)

If precision is low then you will be seeing many FPs. 

There is a P-R curve that applies to your model, and your model's inference output will exist on a point in this curve. You can move this point by changing the `--conf-thres` used during inference (in detect.py), and also in test.py. As `--conf-thres` trends to 1 precision will also trend to 1 (and recall to zero). 

So there's no such concept as your model's precision being too low. The precision is up to you, it's currently at the point you are requesting with your present `--conf-thres`.

Here is a P-R curve for Person class in YOLOv3-SPP for example, as tested on coco_500val.data. If your precision is low, your recall is high, and vice versa. You can select any point on this curve by varying your `--conf-thres`, up to the maximum available recall (~0.86 in this case).

@glenn-jocher
I have a question about --conf-thres, precision is low  will generate many FPs, if you turn it up during training, will it make the MAP bigger ?
@www12345678 no. increasing conf-thres will always reduce your mAP.

@glenn-jocher
I didn't make it very clear, so let me rephrase it.
You know , the low precision will produce many FPs, if you turn it up during training, it will produce a small amount FPs, this changes don't matter recall, with the FPs decrease, the precision=TP/(TP+FP) will increase, this is what I get.
 Could you explain your understanding in detail？

issue.title: conf_threshold dilemma

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
@glenn-jocher I have one more question, in issue #310 you mentioned we should keep the conf_threshold at 0.001 for getting the final score on validation set (running test.py) But then you also suggest to keep the threshold between 0.1-0.9 depending on recall-precision flavor we want for our detection. 
What if I have to detect on a set and at the same time give them the mAP of my detection? Or lets say I give them the predictions on dataset and they test the mAP on their own out of that. What would you suggest in that case? Thanks!

issue.body:
Hello~
I'm facing the problem of weight conversion
Before the conversion, detect.py works fine and BBox was good.
But, there is no detection(BBox) after using the weight conversion in readme (.pt to .weight)
Does anyone know about it????

body:
I think in my case increasing the conf-thresh does not have an effect on the mAP. it affects only R & P. Since the mAP is calculated based on IOU-Thresh, not conf_thresh. am I right?

But I am still confused on one thing. How can I know which conf-thresh is the best one to give me the minimum fp and fn since these are the things we did not want for the model to avoid.  If you say just by seeing the P-R curve how to know the exact numeric value?:
